title: Human-Centered Artificial Intelligence
description: Examination of artificial intelligence (AI) through a human-first approach: the creation of AI systems, where the human perspective and needs drive the technological innovations throughout all stages of the system design including data collection, learning models, inference strategies, interaction paradigms, validation, deployment, evaluation, and maintenance. Prerequisites: DSC 208R and DSC 255R. Restricted to major code DS77. All other students with graduate standing may be considered as space permits.
